intro: Hieracium bergstroemii, commonly known as Bergströms hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and often covered with fine hairs. The yellow flowers appear in summer, producing small seeds that are dispersed by wind.
